column1: International Development with Conflict and Humanitarian Action
column3: Department of Social and Policy Sciences
column5: Develop an in-depth understanding and specialist skills in contemporary development issues, peacebuilding, conflict analysis, and humanitarian response.If you are interested in studying the part-time version of this course, please visit our website.Throughout this course, you’ll analyse the core global challenges of conflict and humanitarian crises and explore a variety of tools and approaches to respond effectively to the challenges they bring.This course is influenced by Bath’s longstanding engagement in conflict and humanitarian response. You’ll critically assess real-world case studies to draw links across global, regional, national and local scales.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
